2.7 Single-step vs. Multi-step
A forecast problem that requires a prediction of the next time step is called a one-step forecast
model. Whereas a forecast problem that requires a prediction of more than one time step is
called a multi-step forecast model. The more time steps to be projected into the future, the more
challenging the problem given the compounding nature of the uncertainty on each forecasted
time step.
Âˆ One-step: Forecast the next time step.
